review_title: Lecanto campus is quiet but quaint
job_title: Library Reference Services Assistant (Student Job) in Lecanto, FL
pros: I did the maximum hours allowed (which isn't a lot) while getting my nursing program prereqs done. They are very kind there and I felt very relaxed and were understanding of the student hours and study needs. I learned a lot about shelving, answering and redirecting phones, cataloguing books, but most importantly: teaching students how to make the printer work!!!!
cons: It was very relaxing but sometimes I felt a bit sleepy. It's not soul-crushingly boring, just very slow on most days.

pros: Students were polite, for the most part.  Staff was generally congenial.  Nice weather.  Small campus and easy to navigate.
cons:
I was hired to teach two sections of English in the accelerated curriculum.  However, an emergency situation was created for two other classes in the normal curriculum because the teacher had a stroke, and two successive replacements, for whatever reason, did not work out.  So, I was the third replacement, and it was close to the middle of the term.  Not an easy situation.  I did encounter one discipline problem with a student who was removed from the class and possibly expelled from the school -- not sure about that.

In any case, I found little support or sympathy for the difficulty I was placed in, by anyone.  I was scheduled for classes for the following term, but withdrew after the incident.  However, later, after things calmed and asked that I be put on the schedule, they told me those classes had given to another person.  So, that was it for me

review_title: Unwilling or clueless on how to change
pros: Great Benefits. Holidays off. Will promote from within. Comfortable work space.
cons:
I don't know whether they are unwilling to change or just have no idea what to do with the changes in the higher education marketplace but they are obviously struggling. They have created a great facade where it seems like they value their employees with the events they hold and recognition systems (like wows) but none of that translates into the actual work environment. They are a leader in this community but are reluctant to pay full time wages and I'm sorry but higher wages mean better people and then you produce a better product. They have a ton of turn-over. But yet they will keep someone for 25 years who creates a hostile work environment. They will keep people just because they don't want to do their job and don't want to search for someone better. So if being mediocre, being paid mediocre, but having lots of time off and great benefits appeals to you this is your place. If you are looking for part-time work or if that is all that's available it's limited to 25 hours a week and the pay is very low. However, if you aren't in a financial strain they will promote from within but it's not because they necessarily believe in you it's because they're lazy and you're in front of them. 
They are also way behind technology wise. I have Windows 2003 on my computer, that's 12 years old! I'll get documents from people and I have to open them in compatibility mode and sometimes I can't access features; so embarrassing when your dealing with outside professionals.

pros: Gave me an opportunity to help myself by helping others.  By explaining math to others I solidified my understanding, and learned how to think about things in other ways.  Also had the advantage that when it was slow I had the opportunity to work on my own school-work.
cons: As a part-time student tutor I wasn't able to get enough hours to support myself, so I still needed a second job.

pros: Great location, beautiful campus, and some great minds that will never be recognized to their full potential.  A nice place to take a few classes before moving on.
cons: Since the new president came, long-time employees have quit and retired in droves.  He has his own self-interests in mind and has created a tension among dedicated employees that is embarrassing considering the leaders before.  The technology department is a mess as well.  Check the credentials on the IT staff...most of them have none to very little education/certification credentials.

pros: Met many great minds and made solid references and contacts.
cons:
* Incompetence trickles down from the President's desk and creates an unprofessional, non-progressive, sometimes hostile work environment.  

* Even when it's spelled out for them, they do not recognize talent and actually discourage innovation.  

* Pay, hours, benefits, and morale are all low relative to similar institutions.

review_title: A great place to work and go to college
pros: The staff are all friendly and helpful. It was a pleasure working in the college library. Everyone works together as a team.
cons: I experience absolutely no problems while working at the College of Central Florida. This is a great, flexible bunch of folks to work with.

review_title: Wonderful place to work if you're a busy student who needs income.
pros: The hours are 15 per week at $8.56 per hour.
cons: Because you can only work 15 hours per week, I would be careful to ensure that you meet those 15 hours every single week to get a nicer paycheck.

review_title: Excellent Learning Environment with great support
job_title: Instructor, College Or University in Ocala, FL
pros: Well educated seasoned staff who are always willing to share knowledge. Supportive administration and team leaders.  Great pay for part-time (adjunct) work.
cons: Limited and  no guaranteed hours for adjuncts. No ability to access classrooms after hours to complete work.  No benefits.

cons: Slightly lower pay, but the real payoff is time to live your life!
